name: getListsIdMergeFieldsId
description: Get information about a specific merge field.

list_id.description: The unique ID for the list.

merge_id.description: The id for the merge field.

exclude_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

$ul: **_links**: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.
**default_value**: The default value for the merge field if `null`.
**display_order**: The order that the merge field displays on the list signup form.
**help_text**: Extra text to help the subscriber fill out the form.
**list_id**: The ID that identifies this merge field's audience'.
**merge_id**: An unchanging id for the merge field.
**name**: The name of the merge field (audience field).
**options**: Extra options for some merge field types.
**choices**: In a radio or dropdown non-group field, the available options for contacts to pick from.
**date_format**: In a date or birthday field, the format of the date.
**default_country**: In an address field, the default country code if none supplied.
**phone_format**: In a phone field, the phone number type: US or International.
**size**: In a text field, the default length of the text field.
**public**: Whether the merge field is displayed on the signup form.
**required**: The boolean value if the merge field is required.
**tag**: The merge tag used for Mailchimp campaigns and [adding contact information](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/#add-merge-data-to-contacts).
**type**: The [type](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/#structure) for the merge field.

$block: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

$ul: **detail**: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
**instance**: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.
**status**: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.
**title**: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.
**type**: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.
